intro: Hieracium obliquifolium, commonly known as the bent-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a wavy or zigzag margin, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
